title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

Baur joined #xwiki at 08:33  
Baur - (08:33): hi  
Baur - (08:34): how can I get a comment count of my rss feed  
Baur - (08:39): ping  
Stulle joined #xwiki at 08:47  
Stulle - (08:47): morning  
Stulle - (08:47): cjdelisle: did you come up with anything regarding the upload/revisioning of attachement?  
cjdelisle - (08:48): No. What's your database, mysql?  
Stulle - (08:48): PostgreSQL  
cjdelisle - (08:49): Hmm. I'm running the same.  
Stulle - (08:49): are running it on a linux or win environment?  
cjdelisle - (08:50): Linux but "that shouldn't matter" ;)  
Stulle - (08:50): that's what i thought when the OpenOffice Import was partially broken because IE did send the entire path rather than just the name and it did not work on windows... ;)  
Stulle - (08:50): anyway, that's fixed now^^  
Stulle - (08:51): so the question remains, what is horribly wrong with my setup that keeps me from using that?!  
cjdelisle - (08:53): Do you have the problem if the document name has no accents? It's a long shot but we might as well eliminate it from inquery.  
Stulle - (08:54): well, i am aware this can cause problems... that is why all my documents are saved in ASCII only chars  
Stulle - (08:54): without spaces or anything  
Stulle - (08:55): i mean the name is ASCII only  
cjdelisle - (08:55): Ok, the document name in the error trace you gave had an accent in it.  
Stulle - (08:56): O\_o it did???  
Stulle - (08:56): that was the wiki page  
Stulle - (08:56): [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)äche  
Stulle - (08:56): anyway, it also happend on Sandbox.TestPage2  
cjdelisle - (08:57): Ok.  
Stulle - (08:57): which was in it's original state upon test  
cjdelisle - (09:20): Stulle, After looking at the code again, I see there isn't much information I can get from your error stack trace.  
Stulle - (09:21): i see  
cjdelisle - (09:21): Faced with a problem, I would try setting up a new database (in postgres) and see if it works that way.  
Stulle - (09:21): okay, will do that later on  
cjdelisle - (09:21): You can open an issue in jira and the least we can do is make it easier to debug in the future.  
Stulle - (09:22): btw, setting up the database worked a little different than described in the corresponding article  
cjdelisle - (09:22): What was different and what was the article?  
Stulle - (09:22): at least in the latest version on windows  
Stulle - (09:22): well, the commands are not like that anymore...  
Stulle - (09:22): hold on  
Stulle - (09:23): IIRC, USER and cjdelisle GROUP are not valid like that anymore  
Stulle - (09:23): but it had some kind of user role thing  
Stulle - (09:24): yeah, login roles...  
cjdelisle - (09:24): Did you use createuser and createdb?  
Stulle - (09:24): well, i made several attempts to be honest  
Stulle - (09:24): and in the end i think i made it entirely via the pgAdmin III GUI  
Stulle - (09:25): oh right and encoding is not UNICODE but UTF-8  
cjdelisle - (09:26): Is there anything else in your log just before what you pasted? maybe something about a psql error?  
Stulle - (09:26): will test it again, hold on a minute  
Stulle - (09:30): http://pastebin.ca/1969686  
Stulle - (09:30): did the following  
Stulle - (09:30): went to TestPage2  
Stulle - (09:30): uploaded Blub.png  
cjdelisle - (09:30): Nope, I can't get any info out of that. Sorry.  
Stulle - (09:31): opened Blub.png locally in Paint.net, defaced it  
Stulle - (09:31): uploaded local copy again  
Stulle - (09:31): then opened the picture  
Stulle - (09:31): returned to page and hit f5  
sburjan joined #xwiki at 09:35  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 09:37

sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:01  
Enygma` left at 10:03 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
mflorea - (10:05): sdumitriu: I'm looking for a CSS SAC writer/serializer/filter but I can't find any.. I want to write a CSS filter (much like a XML SAX filter) to transfrom CSS selectors (namespace to prevent conflicts in portlet mode) and to rewrite @import URLs. I doesn't look complicated to write a CSS SAC writer but I'm surprised there's no library that includes one..  
tmortagne - (10:06): sdumitriu: looks like you forgot to upgrade main wiki on myxwiki.org, http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=Groups does not work  
tmortagne - (10:06): or at least part of main wiki  
sdumitriu left at 10:07 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
sburjan - (10:11): tmortagne: I confirm that the bug has been fixed (tested the OO server) .. and it works from admin page. no errors in console even. Great job !  
tmortagne - (10:11): also there is an important issue on myxwiki.org: impossible to save objects at least on http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/XWiki/XWikiSASGroup?editor=object  
sburjan - (10:11): now I'll test Extension Manager  
tmortagne - (10:11): sburjan: that's actually cjdelisle correction ;)  
sburjan - (10:12): I know, but it's you who found the problem :) Congrats to cjdelisle  for fixing it so fast :)  
cjdelisle - (10:12): gmorning.  
cjdelisle - (10:13): Git to give a lot of credit to maven. Trying to build something with ant and just now realize how privative it is.  
Stulle - (10:13): quick question, is there a way to insert an http:// address into a text without making it appear as a link?  
tmortagne - (10:13): Stulle: yes, by escaping it  
tmortagne - (10:13): http~://  
Stulle - (10:14): ah, okay, thanks  
tmortagne - (10:14): see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax  
Stulle - (10:15): actually it's not there for all i can see... at least not in the links section ;)  
Stulle - (10:15): anyway, thanks^^  
tmortagne - (10:17): it's not about link only  
tmortagne - (10:17): you can escape any syntax  
tmortagne - (10:18): see "Escapes" section  
Stulle - (10:18): right, something i am not too familiar with but i think i understood how it works after all  
tmortagne - (10:19): [myxwiki.org] Restarting myxwiki.org  
sburjan - (10:20): tmortagne: ExtensionManager works too .. tested install and uninstall too ..  
tmortagne - (10:20): sburjan: ok great  
tmortagne - (10:20): hmm looks like i lost sudo right on myxwiki.org  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 10:23  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 10:23  
fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 10:24  
tmortagne - (10:26): [myxwiki.org] Restarted, should be ready in several minutes  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:32  
mflorea - (10:35): cjdelisle: the registration application used on 2.5 and 2.6 branches doesn't work: Caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'find' in  class org.xwiki.velocity.tools.RegexTool threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at xwiki:XWiki.Registration[line 504, column 16] . This is critical for 2.5 branch because sdumitriu was planning to release 2.5 final today.  
cjdelisle - (10:36): That was backported to 2.5? I thought you said yesterday that the new version was not going to be backported.  
vmassol - (10:37): hmm I wonder if we can enforce the use of JDK 1.5 during the release process by putting something in the pom. I'll look into that, I think it's easy to do  
vmassol - (10:37): and it's such a pain for clirr…. all those excludes  
vmassol - (10:37): http://maven.apache.org/enforcer/enforcer-rules/requireJavaVersion.html  
vmassol - (10:37): I'll put it in the release profile  
mflorea - (10:39): cjdelisle: I haven't said anything, I just noticed that some of the WYSIWYG selenium tests fail on 2.5 although I haven't committed anything on the WYSIWYG  
sburjan - (10:39): tmortagne: done .. added 3 screenshots to also illustrate visually how to install an extension  
tmortagne - (10:40): sburjan: ok cool  
cjdelisle - (10:40): If 2.5 is going to release the new version of XAADMIN, I'm rolling back everything I committed that's not a regression.  
jvelociter - (10:40): sburjan: we could make a small screencast video to demo that, too  
baur joined #xwiki at 10:40  
jvelociter - (10:40): for example, installing the jruby.jar  
cjdelisle - (10:40): I am not going to commit a change to be released the next day.  
jvelociter - (10:41): and then demonstrating writing a short script in ruby  
jvelociter - (10:41): w/o restart of the wiki  
sburjan - (10:41): yes, we could .. but it's still experimental. Don't know if it is worth it yet  
tmortagne - (10:41): cjdelisle: no it's not, as i already tald you, look at XE pom.xml  
tmortagne - (10:41): s/tald/told/  
jvelociter - (10:41): I think it is. We don't have to make a big announcement out of it  
cjdelisle - (10:42): ``<mflorea> cjdelisle: the registration application used on 2.5 and 2.6 branches doesn't work: Caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'find' in  class org.xwiki.velocity.tools.RegexTool threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at xwiki:XWiki.Registration[line 504, column 16] . This is critical for 2.5 branch because sdumitriu was planning to release 2.5 final today.''  
jvelociter - (10:42): but for people who follow XWiki news, etc. it's exciting  
jvelociter - (10:42): of course we have to say it's experimental  
mflorea - (10:42): tmortagne: then registration app version should be locked on XE 2.5 pom  
tmortagne - (10:43): cjdelisle: actually i tough you were talking about 2.4  
tmortagne - (10:43): (which is the version for which we talked yesterday)  
tmortagne - (10:44): it does not make sense to do a modification on an app incompatiblee with 2.5  
cjdelisle - (10:44): I will not commit anything except regression bug fixes unless it has at least a week of testing before release.  
tmortagne - (10:44): that's the dev branch...  
sburjan - (10:44): are we still going to release 2.5 final today ? or we postpone till monday  
tmortagne - (10:45): mflorea: no it should not  
cjdelisle - (10:45): This seems to happen ever release. "surprise, that's getting released tomorrow"  
tmortagne - (10:45): there is bugfixes in admin app  
tmortagne - (10:45): for 2.5  
tmortagne - (10:45): so if you committed something incompatible with 2.5 revert it and do it the proper way with a branch  
mflorea - (10:45): +1  
tmortagne - (10:47): but why the hell do we already need to do incompatible modification on app with what is the current dev branch ?  
cjdelisle - (10:47): This is never practiced though so I'm not quite sure how it's done.  
baur left at 10:47 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
tmortagne - (10:51): cjdelisle: "If 2.5 is going to release the new version of XAADMIN, I'm rolling back everything I committed that's not a regression." what is not a  regression ? the fact that OO importer UI in unusable is a regression for sure...  
tmortagne - (10:52): yesterday you asked about 2.4 and not 2.5 for incompatibility things  
tmortagne - (10:53): and AFAIK drop permission feature is in 2.5, isn't it ?  
cjdelisle - (10:53): ``what is not a  regression ?'' deprecation of functions in 2.6 and stopping using them in 2.5.  
cjdelisle - (10:53): sorry: "stopping using them in XAADMIN"  
vmassol - (10:54): could someone with JDK 1.5 go in platform/pom, do a svn up, do a mvn clean install and then try mvn clean install -Prelease to verify it works?  
baur joined #xwiki at 10:54  
vmassol - (10:54): (I don't have JDK 1.5 anymore apparently on my mac — somehow my 1.5 version is a 1.6....)  
tmortagne - (10:55): cjdelisle: we  need admin app in 2.5 for the fix you did so of course you should not make it incompatible with 2.5  
tmortagne - (10:55): but i don't understand  
tmortagne - (10:55): what is not compatible with 2.5 ?  
cjdelisle - (10:55): It's not incompatable.  
cjdelisle - (10:55): It's untested.  
cjdelisle - (10:55): I won't release code until it has been tested for a while.  
cjdelisle - (10:56): It also seems that it has a bug.  
tmortagne - (10:56): it's a bugfix, currently it's better with than without your fix  
tmortagne - (10:56): but i don't see what it has to do with registration  
tmortagne - (10:57): unless you are not talking about your programming right handling fix  
tmortagne - (10:57): in that case just don't listen to me ;)  
baur - (10:57): hi guys, I am using xwiki-enterprise-installer-windows-2.4.3.exe standalone verion of xwiki. Now I want it to be availabel online. how can I do it?  
sburjan - (10:58): baur: wdym available ?  
tmortagne - (10:58): baur: you don't really have anything to do at XWiki level, it's mostly about giving access to the computer where XWiki is running  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 10:59  
sburjan - (10:59): you put it on a machine that has access to Internet :)  
baur - (10:59): ok  
tmortagne - (10:59): so installing XWiki on a server somewhere or make sure people can access the computer were Xwiki is currentlt  
cjdelisle - (11:00): it's XAINVITATION-14: Stop using deprecated com.xpn.xwiki.api.Context#getUtil() and XAADMINISTRATION-183: Stop using deprecated com.xpn.xwiki.api.Context#getUtil() in XWiki.Registration  
tmortagne - (11:00): or ask for a wiki on myxwiki.org if you don't have a critical usage of the wiki  
cjdelisle - (11:00): They're not blockers, they have not had enough testing, and one has a bug.  
sdumitriu - (11:01): Gooood morning  
tmortagne - (11:01): so indeed you should revert them if they don't fix anything for 2.5  
tmortagne - (11:01): ( cjdelisle )  
vmassol - (11:01): anyone can help testing on jdk 1.5?  
sburjan - (11:01): Good morning sdumitriu  :)  
vmassol - (11:01): sdumitriu: maybe you can help!  
vmassol - (11:01): :)  
tmortagne - (11:01): and then either recommit then after 2.5 is released or create a branch if you think it's way too dangerous for 2.5.1 but i guess not  
cjdelisle - (11:02): vmassol,  I built platform with 2.5 last night, it built for me.  
vmassol - (11:02): "could someone with JDK 1.5 go in platform/pom, do a svn up, do a mvn clean install and then try mvn clean install -Prelease to verify it works?"  
vmassol - (11:02): cjdelisle: not sure what you're talking about  
cjdelisle - (11:02): I'll git svn up and rebuild again in a minute.  
vmassol - (11:02): cjdelisle: I've added checks so that we cannot release with a non jdk 1.5 version  
vmassol - (11:02): I've tested it on my java 1.6  
vmassol - (11:03): but I'd like to make sure it works with jdk 1.5  
vmassol - (11:03): (and I don't have one)  
tmortagne - (11:03): cool  
cjdelisle - (11:03): Oh. ok. sorry for the noise and yes I'd be gld to give it a try.  
tmortagne - (11:03): vmassol: planned to release 2.4 this morning, i can maybe try a real release with that, WDYT ?  
tmortagne - (11:03): s/2.4/2.4.4/  
vmassol - (11:04): tmortagne: ok, you'll need the new top level pom  
tmortagne - (11:04): ha  
tmortagne - (11:04): that's not going to happen i think  
tmortagne - (11:04): but i can put the thing on some pom  
tmortagne - (11:04): like core-parent  
tmortagne - (11:04): to test  
vmassol - (11:04): tmortagne: I don't think it's needed  
vmassol - (11:04): if you can test on trunk it's probably good enough  
vmassol - (11:05): 2.4 branch is going to go away soon anyway  
tmortagne - (11:05): sure but it was to test it  
vmassol - (11:05): we'll want 2.5 branch to use the latest top level pom  
vmassol - (11:05): tmortagne: to test it's easy  
vmassol - (11:05): just run with -Prelease  
vmassol - (11:05): or -DperformRelease=true  
sdumitriu - (11:06): vmassol: K, I'll try  
vmassol - (11:06): thanks  
tmortagne - (11:06): maybe we should build with DperformRelease=true in hudson  
sdumitriu - (11:07): 1.5 works, 1.6 fails  
vmassol - (11:07): sdumitriu: cool  
mflorea - (11:07): sdumitriu: do you know any good CSS mailing list where I could ask about a CSS SAC writer/serializer/filter?  
sdumitriu - (11:08): mflorea: Let me check  
sdumitriu - (11:08): Actually, what do you need, code help, or specification help?  
sdumitriu - (11:09): vmassol: Fails with IcedTea (1.6), Works with JamVM (1.5)  
mflorea - (11:09): I need to know if there is a Java CSS SAC writer/serializer/filter out there  
vmassol - (11:09): sdumitriu: even better  
mflorea - (11:09): SAC as in Simple API for CSS (SAX like)  
vmassol - (11:09): (you have all JVMs that exist on your machine? :))  
sdumitriu - (11:10): vmassol: Fails with emul-linux-x86-java-1.6 (32bit version on a 64bit system)  
sdumitriu - (11:11): Fails with 1.4 (maven fails from the start, seems that 1.5 or greater is required to even start maven)  
sdumitriu - (11:11): mflorea: http://www.w3.org/Style/CSS/SAC/Overview.en.html  
sdumitriu - (11:11): "Comments on SAC are invited and are to be sent to the public     mailing list [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)."  
sdumitriu - (11:12): So, [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
cjdelisle - (11:12): About this branching that's supposed to happen. If I were to branch XAADMIN, there is no branched dir at that level so I have to branch all of applications, that's correct?  
sdumitriu - (11:12): On the right it lists a few Java implementations  
mflorea - (11:12): sdumitriu: "This mailing list is for technical discussion on Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) and its specifications"  
silviar joined #xwiki at 11:12  
mflorea - (11:12): "This list is not for posts of the form “How do I...”"  
tmortagne - (11:12): cjdelisle: no it's not  
sdumitriu - (11:12): We're already using Batik, so you can reuse their implementation if it works well enough  
tmortagne - (11:12): look at how it's done for tags for example  
cjdelisle - (11:13): Ok, I'll look in a second, second question is wht version number does it get?  
tmortagne - (11:13): actually there is branched  
tmortagne - (11:13): branches  
tmortagne - (11:13): examples  
tmortagne - (11:13): on http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/branches/  
sdumitriu - (11:13): cjdelisle: mvn release:branch inside the admin app does the right thing  
cjdelisle - (11:13): 1.34.2?  
sdumitriu - (11:13): cjdelisle: But it requires SVN  
tmortagne - (11:13): cjdelisle: that's release version not branch version  
mflorea - (11:13): I looked at Batik but I could see a CSS writer (plus I don't think they use SAC), I look closer though (i.e. in the source code)  
tmortagne - (11:14): for branch name it's working the same way that core/web/XE etc...  
mflorea - (11:14): s/could/couldn't  
cjdelisle - (11:14): ``<tmortagne> cjdelisle: that's release version not branch version'' But XE needs a release version, not a branch correct?  
tmortagne - (11:14): if you branch version 1.34 then the branch name is 1.34  
tmortagne - (11:14): i don't understand  
tmortagne - (11:14): you want to create a branch, right ?  
cjdelisle - (11:15): How do you make sure the branch is picked up when XE2.5 is released?  
cjdelisle - (11:15): As opposed to using the trunk version.  
tmortagne - (11:15): you explain it in XE pom.xml  
cjdelisle - (11:15): If they both have the same version number then I think it's the last one to be built. Correct?  
tmortagne - (11:16): they don't have the same version  
cjdelisle - (11:16): Ok so then I must change the version number of the branch, correct?  
tmortagne - (11:16): the "trunk" of the application is 1.35-SNAPSHOT and the branch 1.34-SNAPSHOT  
mflorea left at 11:16 (Quit: Leaving.  
lucaa left at 11:16 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
tmortagne - (11:16): again do exactly like core/XE  
tmortagne - (11:16): when we branch XE 2.5 the branch is 2.5  
cjdelisle - (11:17): Ok so if the trunk is 1.34 then I advance the version of the trunk and branch the version that the runk is currently.  
tmortagne - (11:17): cjdelisle: what is the last version released ?  
tmortagne - (11:18): of the application you want to branch  
cjdelisle - (11:18): administration shows v1.42-SNAPSHOT so I'm assuming it was 1.41.  
tmortagne - (11:18): so the branch is 1.41 because the next version is going to be 1.41.1  
tmortagne - (11:18): and the trunk is 1.42-SNAPSHOT  
tmortagne - (11:19): which mean the branch will be 1.41-SNAPSHOT  
cjdelisle - (11:19): 1.41.1 ? has XAADMIN ever been versioned like that?  
tmortagne - (11:20): that' show all branched application has been released ?  
tmortagne - (11:20): how do you want to do a branch ?  
tmortagne - (11:20): again it's the same thing than XE  
tmortagne - (11:20): XE 2.4, 2.4.1, etc...  
tmortagne - (11:20): or i really don't understand your question  
cjdelisle - (11:21): XAADMIN has only ever been branched once and it does not have an W.XY.Z type of version number.  
tmortagne - (11:21): cjdelisle: yes it does  
cjdelisle - (11:21): 1.10-SNAPSHOT  
tmortagne - (11:21): and ?  
tmortagne - (11:22): do we have 2.4.4-SNAPSHOT in XE pom.xml ?  
cjdelisle - (11:22): that's 1.10-SNAPSHOT not 1.10.1-SNAPSHOT as said above.  
tmortagne - (11:22): the version in the branch is the <branch version>-SNAPSHOT  
tmortagne - (11:22): are you looking at what i'm writing ?  
tmortagne - (11:23): as i already said 1.10.1 is a release version  
tmortagne - (11:23): not a branch version  
cjdelisle - (11:23): Ok, and that style has been used in the applications?  
tmortagne - (11:24): yes as you can see in  http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/branches/  
cjdelisle - (11:25): I guess I will just have to start mining the history to see how this was done.  
tmortagne - (11:26): let say it again:  
tmortagne - (11:26): - create a admin 1.41 branch with 1.41-SNAPSHOT as version  
tmortagne - (11:26): - the trunk version is 1.42-SNAPSHOT  
tmortagne - (11:26): - explain in XE that it's depends on a branch and not on a usual last version of an application  
cjdelisle - (11:27): the trunk version is advanced to 1.42-SNAP during the branch opp. correct?  
tmortagne - (11:27): don't use mvn release:branch  
tmortagne - (11:27): in your case it's more a pain that a benefit  
tmortagne - (11:28): just use svn branch  
tmortagne - (11:28): and set the proper version in the new branch  
cjdelisle - (11:28): I'll write a shell script. There's too much there even for svn branch.  
cjdelisle - (11:28): I have a bad feeling though that the practice has been effectively abandoned for applications, I am going to find bad surprises if I try to implement it now.  
tmortagne - (11:29): i really don't see what is complex about c reating a svn branch and modifying a version in the pom.xml file

ztane - (13:15): should ask this again, it seems xwiki stores the ldap account information somewhere; now, logins are forbidden if the dn (which is not used as the wikiname) is changed...

tmortagne - (13:20): "logins are forbidden if the dn (which is not used as the wikiname) is changed", note that that's fixed in 2.4.4 and 2.5  
evalica joined #xwiki at 13:21  
tmortagne - (13:21): LDAP users are XWiki users with a special object in it  
tmortagne - (13:21): so edit the user profile  
tmortagne - (13:21): with object editor  
tmortagne - (13:21): and you will find the DN, just change it and it should be ok  
tmortagne - (13:21): ( ztane )  
tmortagne - (13:22): note that it's the same thing if you want to make a "normal" user a LDAP user you can add a LDAPProfile object and set the proper uid and DN  
ztane - (13:23): ok :)  
ztane - (13:24): also, i tried making a filter that would allow people to use their email, or unix account instead of the wikiname, but it seemed not work either...
